reviews.review: Songs good and movie was amazing but story was good but hard to explain to people wanting to see it
Too many songs, disjointed plot, too dark and not enough comedy.
Wonderful songs and so funny! Will see it again and again

Disney pretty much nailed it again. A bit more development of the reasoning behind Elsas final decision (no spoilers) would have given it 5 stars for me. Excellent music. Stunning visuals. Olaf=genius!

The only thing I disliked was a promo for Walmart showing a mom & dad buying & discussing Christmas gifts for their daughter.  The theater was packed with young Santa believers and here it’s showing the parents buying the toys at Walmart.  My granddaughter turned and asked me about it.

Party of 14 and it was unanimous that this was fairly boring, especially the first half. The music was not catchy or memorable whatsoever. The story was pretty good for a sequel, but the fact that there was no active villain was a different viewing experience. It was also extremely predicable. Olaf saved the movie for sure. The scene where he caught people up to speed on the last 10 years was outstanding. Plus his constant banter kept us awake. None of us would ever see it a second time in the theater without question. My daughter would probably watch it again on TV sometime. There were a few deeper issues explored, I will give it that. However, the music being awful just couldn’t be overcome. The songs were literal snoozers with little to know effort of fun
really liked the movie but my girls loved it which is the most important part. ages 6,7, and 12.
The music that it was funny and amazing my kids loved it

I loved this sequel!!! The only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars are the songs were not as memorable as the first. I still left wanting to sing Let it Go and Do you want to build a snowman. I can't remember any of the songs from Frozen 2 and I just saw it yesterday.
The story is convoluted, and the songs aren’t very good.
